Bhikkhādāyikā：1．Bhikkhādāyikā． A woman of Uttaramadhurā．The Buddha visited that city for her special benefit．Seeing him as she was returning from her bath，she invited him to her house and gave him a meal．She died soon after and was reborn in Tāvatimsa，where Moggallāna saw her and learnt her story．Vv．ii．10; VvA．118f．

2．Bhikkhādāyikā．A similar story of a woman of Rājagaha who gave alms to an arahant monk and was reborn in Tāvatimsa．Vv．ii．11; VvA．119f．

bhikkhādāyikā：ဘိက္ခာ-ဒါယိကာ （ဣ）
